body.p: The publishing Connectors page shows the publishing connectors that are defined for a project. To reach the page, go to Deliverables (found at the bottom of the left navigation stripe when inside a project), then click Connectors from the left stripe.

section.title: Content Fusion Connectors
section.p: A Content Fusion connector is associated with a deliverable, enabling the publishing for the deliverable's build outputs through the configured connector. Content Fusion offers support for the following connector types:

ul.li: Content Fusion Docs Web Platform - This is a built-in connector that deploys the output to a web platform that is accessible publicly. When you create a new project, Content Fusion automatically generates this connector for that project. For this connector, you can click the View deployments button to see a pop-up window with the deployment builds for this connector. Each deployment includes a link to open the output for the latest successful build. You can share this link with others since the output is public.

section.p: To create a new connector, click the New Connector button located in the top-right corner of the page. Then, select the desired connector type and fill in the necessary fields corresponding to the chosen connector type in the resulting dialog box.
You can click the ellipsis (3 vertical dots) to the right of the particular connector to reveal actions to View deliverables for the connector, Edit it, or Delete it.

section.title: Content Fusion Docs Web Platform
section.p: When you create a new project, Content Fusion automatically generates a publishing connector named Content Fusion Docs Web Platform for that project. This connector enables you to publish the output of your deliverables using a built-in publishing connector that deploys the output to a web platform that is accessible publicly. This feature simplifies the process of publishing and sharing documentation and ensures that all projects are immediately ready for web-based collaboration and publishing.
While the connector is set up automatically for the project, you need to set up deliverables to publish output using the connector.

In the Connectors page, to the right of the Content Fusion Docs Web Platform connector, you can click the View deployments button to see a pop-up window with the deployment builds for this connector. Each deployment includes a link to open the output for the latest successful build. You can share this link with others since the output is public.
Also, you can click the ellipsis (3 vertical dots) to the right of the connector to reveal actions to View deliverables for the connector or Delete it.
